parameters: \N<Painter>I travel around painting and sell my work to make a living.

\N<Painter>I'm not from this town... I managed to avoid being drafted
into the militia, but it looks like I'll be staying here for
a while.

\N<Painter>Well, it's a good opportunity. I'll take this time to
confront my own work and talent.
<ActiveMessage:\C[10]■EV発生■>
\N<Segi>Um... I've read the request board at the management office.
\N<Painter>You have? Are you going to accept my request?
\N<Segi>Yes. Am I not capable of helping you?
\N<Painter>Hmm... No, not at all. You are more than capable.

\N<Painter>Besides, it's not a particularly difficult job. I have no
intention of asking about your experience either.
\N<Segi>Is that so? That's a relief. So... um, what should I do...?

\N<Painter>Well then, let's get to work right away. Could you come over
here?
\N<Segi>Eh...?

\N<Painter>What I want to ask of you is nothing else but to be a model
for a nude painting.

\N<Painter>Of course, I will pay you accordingly. And I promise not to
lay a single finger on your body.

\N<Segi>W-Wait a minute, please... A nude painting, that...! I can't
do... such a thing...

\N<Painter>You can't? Are you saying you refuse? That would be...
problematic. It would cause significant delays in
production...
\N<Segi>...

\N<Painter>...Understood, let's do this. There's no need to take off
your clothes. Can you just get on the bed as you are?
\N<Segi>Just as I am...?

\N<Painter>Yes, that would be fine, wouldn't it? Please... I'm begging
you.

\N<Segi>...Understood. Since I've already accepted the offer, if
that's the case...
i_1_セギ05uu
i_1_セギ05u
\N<Segi>Um... may I ask you something?
\N<Painter>...Yes, of course. You must be bored just sitting there.
i_1_セギ05a

\N<Segi>...Thank you. It's strange for me to accept such an offer
and then say this, but I just can't seem to understand the
taste for art...

\N<Segi>But you seem to be very passionate and committed to your
dream. Why... can you be so earnest?

\N<Painter>The reason I pour my dreams into art...? Indeed, that's a
valid question. However, I'm sorry to disappoint you with a
simple answer.

\N<Painter>It's to satisfy my feelings with things I find beautiful. To
fill this hungry and empty heart with my own aesthetic
sense.
\N<Segi>...

\N<Painter>I have traveled to various places in search of something
that could satisfy my creative desires. In that sense, this
town has what I'm looking for.
\N<Segi>This town has...? What do you mean by that...?

\N<Painter>The hearts of the people living in this town swirl with
suppressed emotions stemming from being occupied by Lyuda
troops. Especially for a good-looking woman like you...
\N<Segi>...

\N<Painter>I find it attractive how such charming women grit their
teeth and still live their days with determination.

\N<Painter>And I want to capture that image not as something ephemeral
but as something universal... in other words, give it form.
Do you understand this feeling?
\N<Segi>...No, I don't quite understand...

\N<Painter>Heh, that's fine. As long as you fulfill your role, I will
pay you your reward.
\N<Segi>...
\N<Segi>Is this... all right for the end?

\N<Painter>Ah, thank you. I am grateful to you. It looks like it will
turn out to be a good piece thanks to you.
\N<Segi>...No.

\N<Painter>Here is the promised reward. Please accept it without
reservation.
\N<Segi>...

\N<Painter>However... it is still far from the true form I seek. If you
are willing, I would very much like your cooperation again.
\N<Segi>I can't promise anything... but I'll think about it.
A
\N<Segi>Um...

\N<Painter>Ah, madam. Does your presence here mean that I may interpret
it as you accepting another job?
\N<Segi>...Yes.
\N<Painter>That's wonderful. Actually, I've been waiting for you.
\N<Segi>Waiting... for me?

\N<Painter>Yes. Once I started painting you as a model, I naturally
wanted you to stay with me until the very end.
\N<Segi>...
\N<Painter>So... shall we continue from where we left off last time?

\N<Painter>Of course, I will pay a suitable reward. And just like last
time, I promise not to lay a single finger on your body.
\N<Segi>...Yes.
i_1_セギ05uu
i_1_セギ05u
\N<Segi>May I... ask you something?
\N<Painter>Yes, please feel free to ask anything.
i_1_セギ05a

\N<Segi>How long will it take to complete the painting you are
working on now? I... don't have any knowledge or experience
in this area, it's just out of curiosity.

\N<Painter>Well... it's hard to say definitively, but with today's
work, we should be about halfway there.
\N<Segi>I see... that's good to hear.
\N<Painter>...
\N<Segi>...

In front of the bed, the man took his place and continued to
work on his creation. A moment of silence passed between
Segi and him.

\N<Painter>...Now, may I indulge in sharing some of my thoughts with
you?
\N<Segi>Eh...?

\N<Painter>...Indeed, your help has greatly advanced my work. However,
recently I've been thinking. My heart sounds an alarm. That
this cannot continue as it is.
\N<Segi>What... do you mean by that?

\N<Painter>Did I not tell you before? My true purpose is to express the
beautiful melancholy of the women in this town.
\N<Segi>...

\N<Painter>Indeed... I cannot call it a true completion if I avoid what
I truly want to create.
\N<Segi>...?

\N<Painter>So here's a proposal. No, I'm not asking you to expose your
skin. Instead... could you at least lower the underwear
you're wearing right now?
\N<Segi>Wha... Yes...!?

\N<Painter>Don't misunderstand me. As I've said many times, I'm not
asking you to expose your skin.

\N<Painter>Did I not say earlier? I want to capture the suppressed
emotions that fill this town... especially the sorrowful
feelings hidden within women.

\N<Painter>And you are a very beautiful woman. The expression you show
while enduring shame... that's what drives me to want to
paint it.
\N<Segi>But...

\N<Painter>I understand if you cannot decide immediately. My request
must indeed be causing you great confusion.
\N<Segi>...

\N<Painter>Understood, let's add some color to the reward. Please
understand. This is purely for the sake of creation. There
are no ulterior motives.

\N<Painter>Besides... as promised, I will not touch you with a single
finger. How about it then...?
\N<Segi>...

Segi thought that might indeed be true. The man's eyes
before her didn't seem to be looking at her in a certain
sense. It felt as if he was staring not at her, but at his
own work of art.

Since the Ryuda troops were stationed in the town, she had
been subjected to lecherous gazes many times... But the eyes
of the man before her seemed different from those vile eyes.
\N<Segi>...

\N<Segi>I'll have to decline adding color to the reward...
Otherwise, my actions would seem like indecent behavior
motivated by money...

\N<Segi>Of course... if we trace it back to the beginning, I
accepted your request because of the reward.

\N<Segi>But that doesn't mean I'm willing to offer my body and seek
more money than desired.
\N<Painter>Then...?
\N<Segi>...
i_1_セギ05b
\N<Segi>...Is this acceptable?

\N<Painter>Yes... I'm grateful. Your expression... it's more than I had
hoped for.
\N<Segi>Please stop saying it like that.

Segi reached for her clothing and lowered her pure white
underwear to her knees. Shame and sorrow inevitably appeared
on her face. And that was precisely the scene the man had
desired.
\N<Segi>...

\N<Painter>...Are you nervous? It must be hard to lower your underwear
in front of a man who is almost a stranger, isn't it?
\N<Segi>Of course... it's inevitable. It couldn't be otherwise...

\N<Painter>My apologies. Then, to distract yourself, could you talk
about yourself this time, if you don't mind?
\N<Segi>About me...?

\N<Painter>Yes. Knowing the background of the person helps add depth to
the creation they model for.
\N<Segi>...
\N<Painter>Your family? Are they well?
\N<Segi>Yes... I have a husband and one son.

\N<Painter>A son... that's good, wonderful. So you are a wife... and a
mother, then.
\N<Segi>...?

The man's eyes held a smoldering colorless light. Segi did
not understand what that light signified.
\N<Segi>...

\N<Painter>A beautiful married woman like you, alone with a man in a
small room, on a bed, exposing your skin... I wonder what
kind of face your son would make if he saw this scene...

\N<Segi>Stop, please don't say such things. If you're going to talk
like that... I'll have to stop this immediately.

\N<Painter>Ah, my apologies. It just slipped out. It's a bad habit of
mine. However... the incongruity between your background and
your current actions does indeed enhance your allure.
\N<Painter>I'm simply excited by that... I hope you can understand.
\N<Segi>...

\N<Painter>I must capture that allure without missing anything, and
then commit it to canvas. That's all there is to it. So
please, rest assured on your part as well.

\N<Painter>This is by no means infidelity. It's strictly business. Just
work in response to a request made to me. There's no need
for shame.

\N<Segi>...I understand. I have no intention of committing
infidelity either.
\N<Painter>Yes... that's fine. Shall we finish up the rest then?
\N<Segi>...
\N<Segi>Is this... the end then?

\N<Painter>Ah, thank you. I am grateful to you. It seems like it will
turn out to be a good piece thanks to you.
\N<Segi>...No. In return...

\N<Painter>Ah, of course. I swear that today's matter will remain our
secret.

\N<Segi>...? I believe I declined your offer to add a bonus to my
compensation?

\N<Painter>Please don't say that and accept it. This is purely a token
of my appreciation. It's not something for you to worry
about.
\N<Segi>...

\N<Painter>However... it's still far from the true form I seek. If
you're willing, I would very much like your cooperation
again.
\N<Segi>I can't make any promises, but... I'll consider it.
OriginMenuStatus SetParam param2 Gloomy
A
\N<Segi>...

\N<Painter>Ah, madam. May I take it that you will accept more work from
me?
\N<Segi>...Yes.

\N<Painter>I'm relieved. This piece has become unimaginable without
you. You are that significant to me.
\N<Segi>...
\N<Painter>Then... shall we continue from where we left off last time?

\N<Painter>Of course, I will pay a proper reward. And just like last
time, I promise not to lay a finger on your body.
\N<Segi>...Yes.
i_3_セギ01u
\N<Segi>That... may I ask you something?
\N<Painter>Yes, anything. If it helps to distract you.
i_3_セギ01a

\N<Segi>...Previously, you mentioned that the progress of the work
was about halfway... how is it now?

Lying on the bed with a puzzled expression, Segi responds to
the man's request by revealing her underwear, just as
before.

She seems to have developed some resistance compared to
before, but she's certainly not accustomed enough to feel
nothing at all.

\N<Painter>Ah, that matter. You must be curious. Actually... it's
mostly complete, but embarrassingly, I'm a bit troubled with
the direction.
\N<Segi>Direction...?

\N<Painter>No need to worry. Since you're taking time out of your
valuable schedule to assist me, I will make sure to create
something satisfactory.
\N<Segi>Oh, no... it's not that I...

How many times has this happened? A strange silence flows
between the man swiftly moving his brush and her.
\N<Segi>...

\N<Painter>As much as I hate to say it, you as a model are impeccable.
If that's the case, then the problem lies with my own
skills.
\N<Segi>...

\N<Painter>To have a perfect model and environment yet not be able to
produce a satisfactory piece... it's truly shameful on my
part.

\N<Segi>Honestly, I don't quite understand these matters... but it
must be difficult.

\N<Segi>Not that I'm one to speak, but perhaps it would be better
not to overwork yourself...
\N<Painter>...
\N<Segi>...

The man seemed to be pondering something with a troubled
look. Eventually, he stopped his brush and spoke.

\N<Painter>You might be right. Perhaps I have been overworking myself.
Frustrated by knowing the cause yet unable to resolve it.
\N<Segi>...?

\N<Painter>Yes... there's no point in hiding it any longer. I have a
favor to ask of you, though it shames me.
\N<Segi>...What is it?
\N<Painter>Please take off your clothes... and put this on instead?
\N<Segi>Eh...!?

The man suddenly handed something to Segi. It was a large,
white robe-like garment that had been hanging in the corner
of the room.
\N<Segi>Th-that is...!?

\N<Painter>Please don't misunderstand. There is no ulterior motive. It
is purely for the sake of my art.

\N<Painter>Of course, I'm not asking you to expose your bare skin. You
may cover yourself with this.
\N<Segi>But...

\N<Painter>I simply wish to glimpse what lies behind your
embarrassment. I believe that only then can I truly express
myself as I desire.
\N<Painter>What do you say?
\N<Segi>...
I understand.
I can't do that.
了承する
\N<Segi>I understand...

She didn't necessarily trust him, but she could imagine that
the man wasn't lying.

The funds needed for her husband's rescue, and a
satisfactory result for the man's creative work. Segi
convinced herself to accept the man's proposal, weighing
both sides of the scale.
\N<Segi>Wait, please, in exchange...
\N<Painter>Of course, I promise. This will be our little secret.
\N<Segi>...
\N<Painter>How is it? Are you done changing?
\N<Segi>...Yes.
\N<Painter>Good, then let us begin, shall we?
\N<Segi>...
i_3_セギ01b
\N<Segi>...
\N<Painter>Madam... how do you feel? Is there still... resistance?
\N<Segi>...Of course. There's no way I could be happy about this...
\N<Segi>...

\N<Painter>I am aware that I am forcing you into this. However, I ask
you to bear with it a little longer.

Lying on the bed in such a precarious state, covered only by
underwear and a large cloth.

The fragile sense of insecurity and embarrassment brought a
strange and bewitching expression to Segi's face that was
difficult to describe.
\N<Segi>...

\N<Painter>Yes, that's it. That expression is exactly what I've been
seeking. It's that look on your face... without a doubt,
it's what I wanted.

\N<Painter>With that, I can truly immerse myself in this creation.
Yes... I must not forget my original purpose.
\N<Painter>What my work was missing... was a sense of tragedy.
\N<Segi>A sense of tragedy...?

\N<Painter>Having you, the perfect subject, before me, it seems I had
lost sight of my original goal. I am eternally grateful to
you. My thanks cannot be expressed enough.
\N<Segi>It's not like... I mean...

\N<Painter>Ah, my apologies. My hand had stopped. It seems I was a bit
excited.
\N<Segi>...

\N<Painter>(That's right... The sense of tragedy she radiates. That was
what my work was lacking.)
\N<Painter>(If that's the case, then... for that purpose...)
\N<Segi>Is this... the end?

\N<Painter>Yes, thank you. I am grateful to you. It seems the piece
will turn out well thanks to your help.
\N<Segi>...No. In return...

\N<Painter>Ah, of course. I swear today's matter will go no further
than us.

\N<Segi>...? I thought I made it clear that I declined the offer to
add a bonus to my compensation?

\N<Painter>Please don't say that and accept it. This is purely a token

\N<Segi>...

\N<Painter>However... I am still far from what I truly seek. If you are
willing, I would very much like your cooperation again.
\N<Segi>I can't make any promises, but... I'll think about it.

\N<Segi>...I must decline. I'm sorry, but that is something I cannot

\N<Painter>Is that so... It can't be helped. It's not an act that can

\N<Painter>Yes, thank you. I am grateful to you. It seems the piece

\N<Segi>...

\N<Painter>Ah, madam. You've come again. I was actually worried about
you, as you seemed to have some concerns last time.
\N<Segi>...

\N<Painter>But I'm glad. It's reassuring to see you've returned here
again. As I mentioned before, my work is unimaginable
without you now.
\N<Segi>...
\N<Painter>So... shall we continue from where we left off last time?

\N<Painter>Of course, I will pay a proper reward. And just like last

i_3_セギ01b
\N<Painter>...
\N<Segi>...

As before, Segi undressed and wrapped her body in the white
cloth prepared by the man, then lay down on the bed. Waiting
for this, the man began to move his brush.

\N<Painter>...It must be boring just lying there. So, may I ask about
yourself just for fun?
\N<Segi>About me... I believe I've told you before...

\N<Painter>Yes, indeed that's true, but if it's not too much trouble,
I'd like to know a bit more deeply.

\N<Segi>What do you intend to do with that knowledge? And... is it
really necessary?

\N<Painter>Well... as you say, it's not necessarily so, but let's say
it's needed for this occasion.
\N<Segi>...

The man's intentions were unclear, but hoping to alleviate
the discomfort of the situation even slightly, Segi began to
open up.

\N<Segi>I am... fighting in the training corps in place of my
husband who is not here due to certain circumstances.
\N<Painter>Oh...? A woman like you... must have faced many hardships.

\N<Painter>Ah, I see. So that's why you accepted a request from someone
like me, as a means of support.
\N<Segi>...

\N<Painter>Your dedication for your family is commendable. However, I
surmise that fighting among such strong warriors must be
incredibly harsh.

\N<Painter>That... how have you managed to survive through such brutal
battles?
\N<Segi>That is...
\N<Segi>...

\N<Painter>...I see. A double-edged spiritual medicine that strengthens
the body and mind but also affects the body and spirit.

\N<Painter>So, about that matter with Mind Ryuda, did you actually
experience any effects or abnormalities in your body or mind
after taking it?

\N<Segi>...It's rare for me to feel it myself, but maybe that's why
I'm doing something like this now.
\N<Painter>...I see.

The man suddenly began to ponder something. Then, after a
while, he raised his face and opened his mouth to Segi.

\N<Painter>Now it all makes sense. If that's the case, it's very
convenient for me that you've taken the spiritual medicine,
and I can only be grateful.
\N<Segi>Grateful... you say?

\N<Painter>Yes... So you have such circumstances. It was indeed good to
confirm.

\N<Painter>My choice was not mistaken. What will happen from now on
will be for your sake as well as mine. I am relieved.
\N<Segi>Eh...?
\N<Segi>Wha...!!??
\N<Ryuda Soldier>Hehe, sorry to keep you waiting. Are you doing it?
\N<Segi>Who are you...!? What is this...!?

\N<Painter>Ah, as you can see, these are Ryuda soldiers. They agreed
readily when I explained the situation to them.
i_4_セギ03u
\N<Segi>The situation...!? What on earth are you talking about!?
i_4_セギ03a

\N<Ryuda Soldier>Hehe, sorry for the suddenness, ma'am, but not just the
painter sensei here, how about you entertain us too?
\N<Segi>Wha...!!??

Suddenly, a group of Ryuda burst through the door and
forcefully entered the room. They restrained a flustered
Segi and began to strip off their own clothes.
\N<Segi>Stop... please stop this! What on earth is this...!?

Segi turned back to the painter and questioned him loudly.
However, the painter spoke very calmly, in stark contrast to
her.

\N<Painter>Unfortunately, I cannot ask them to stop. Because this is
something I myself have requested. Besides... you are
terribly attractive right now.
\N<Segi>You requested this...!? What are you talking about...!?

\N<Ryuda Soldier>Hehe, when this sensei told us he wanted a certain woman
violated, I wondered what it was all about.

\N<Ryuda Soldier>Ah, it's really a stroke of luck. To think I'd get to screw
a fine woman like you and get paid for it too, right,
painter sensei?

\N<Painter>Yes, of course I'll pay. I want you to fully indulge your
desires with her.
\N<Segi>Eh...!!??

\N<Ryuda Soldier>That's right, ma'am. No use resisting now, just give up and
let it happen quietly.
\N<Segi>Such...!! Wait...!?

\N<Segi>Wha...!!??

The Ryuda soldiers held Segi in a tight grip and pulled down
her underwear. In an instant, Segi's scream echoed through
the cramped room.
\N<Segi>No... nooo...!!

\N<Ryuda Soldier>Hehe, you're the wife rumored to be in the training corps,
right? Showing up in front of people in such an erotic
outfit... I've been wanting to do you for a while now.

\N<Ryuda Soldier>Exactly, it's an eyesore to see such things. But who

\N<Painter>Ah... It's the best, truly beyond expectations. It seems I

It was a terribly bizarre scene. The painter, with a faint
smile on his face, watched Segi cry out in violation and
moved his brush swiftly.
\N<Segi>Nn...nnh! No more...stop...nnh!

\N<Painter>The face of a beautiful woman filled with despair and tears,

\N<Painter>That's not what I'm here for... Right now, I want to

The painter's words were no lie. He did not participate in
the violation himself, nor did he stop it; he simply
continued to move his brush.

\N<Ryuda Soldier>Hehe, what an odd guy. Well then, I'll concentrate on my
work without any reservations.
\N<Segi>Ah! Ah! Haa...nnn!

\N<Ryuda Soldier>Hey, Painter Sensei. The madam is putting her body on the

\N<Painter>Of course... I don't need you to tell me that.
\N<Segi>It was all a lie...wasn't it!? Everything you said...!!

\N<Painter>There's no doubt that you are the best material for me. And
the fact that you showed me your best expression through
this act is just as I expected. There's no lie in that.

In response to Segi's tearful questioning, the painter began
to eloquently sing praises while still moving his brush as
usual.

\N<Painter>However... it is true that I had some concerns about doing

\N<Segi>Then...ah! Ahn! Stop it right now...haa...stop it...!

\N<Painter>But those concerns were unnecessary worries. The so-called

\N<Painter>Because... isn't it so? By doing this act, you can release

\N<Painter>Fu, fufu... Isn't this what they call killing two birds with

\N<Segi>Ah! Haa! Don't joke...!

\N<Painter>So... I want you to show me everything about yourself. And I

\N<Painter>Fu, fufu...fufu... This is it...this is what I've been

\N<Segi>You're crazy...this is madness...! You are...you are...!

Lying on the bed, Segi closed her eyes deeply. The tragedy
that had befallen her in this place days ago resurfaced in
her mind. Then she quietly opened her mouth.

\N<Segi>...You must be an excellent artist. But as a person, you're

No matter how much I try not to remember, the events that
happened here come back to me, and my body stiffens without
realizing it.

As if seeing right through my heart, the man in front of me
who continues to paint speaks up.

\N<Painter>Ah, please relax. There's no need to be so tense. Those
people will not come here anymore. They have served their
purpose.

\N<Painter>It's just the two of us here now. And unlike those men from
before, I will not harm you.

\N<Segi>...Words are cheap. How can I trust what you say after all
that has happened?
\N<Segi>First of all... do you even realize that you've hurt others?

\N<Painter>Haha... that's quite harsh. Then, shall I tell you something
that might make my words more credible?

\N<Painter>You see, I am what you might call impotent. So even if I
were to lust after you, there's nothing I could do about it.
Incidentally, that's why my wife left me.

trustworthy?
